data.title: 15 Celebrities Who Are Descendants From Royalty
data.meta_description: By discovering their direct blood lines to royal figures and monarchs, it's safe to say that celebrity blood lines can be just as imperial as their careers.
data.text:
From Queen Bey to Queen Elizabeth, royalty can bless a person via family bloodline, or via social status.

While many celebrities seem to already feel as if they have royalty status, it’s hard to believe how many famous faces could become even more influential.

By discovering their direct blood lines to royal figures and monarchs, it’s safe to say that celebrity blood lines can be just as imperial as their careers.

Celebrities Who Are Descendants Of Royalty

From Hilary Duff to Brad Pitt, keep scrolling to learn which celebrities are not only Hollywood royalty, but actual royalty too.

Dakota and Elle Fanning

While most of us recognise Elle Fanning from her latest T.V. series, playing Catherine in The Great, it seems that she and older sister Dakota have royal blood after all. As 22nd great-granddaughters of King Edward III, their blood line also connects them to Kate Middleton’s mother, Carole Goldsmith, who is the distant granddaughter of King Edward III.

Which means that the actor-slash-siblings are, not only the 21st cousins to the Duchess of Cambridge, but the coolest sisters in Hollywood.

Rose Leslie

In vast contrast to Ygritte, her character on hit-series Game Of Thrones, Leslie is in fact royal by blood. And not through her marriage to co-star Kit Harington, either.

Leslie’s father is a chieftain of the Aberdeernshire clan Leslie, while her mother is a descendant of King Charles II.

For an extra GoT-themed twist, it looks as if she and Harington are both descendants to King Charles II, making them very distant cousins.

Beyoncé Knowles-Carter

She may be the queen of the music industry, but it seems that Beyoncé may be more royal than we think. As the 25th cousin, once removed, of Queen Elizabeth II, her cultural title of ‘Queen Bey’ makes complete sense now.

Hilary Duff

The original Disney Princess is an 18th cousin of Queen Elizabeth II.

Hilary Duff

Hilary Duff, besides being the original Disney princess, is said to be the most closely related American celebrity to the Queen herself.

The Lizzie McGuire star is her majesty’s 18th cousin, through Alexander Spotswood, who was the 10th great-grandson of Edward III. This what dreams are made of, literally.

Ellen DeGeneres

Hollywood’s funny lady happens to be the 15th cousin of Kate Middleton, the Duchess of Cambridge. Apparently Ellen is also directly descended from King Edward III who reigned in 1327.

Ellen DeGeneres

Comedian, talk-show host and philanthropist, Ellen DeGeneres, happens to be the 15th cousin of Kate Middleton, the Duchess of Cambridge. Apparently, she is also a direct descendent from King Edward III who reigned in 1327.

DeGeneres even claimed her royal blood as a way to bond with one of the smallest royals, Prince George. In an interview, DeGeneres even joked about it, saying: “I saw that picture of Prince George in his robe with President Obama and I’m like, ‘I have a clothing line [ED by Ellen]; I can give him clothes; I can make a special robe for him!'”

Uma Thurman

While she’s definitely Kill Bill royalty in our eyes, Uma Thurman is also carries a royal blood line. Thurman is the 21st cousin, once removed, to Queen Elizabeth thanks to her ancestor, King Edward I of England. Could she get any cooler?

Angelina Jolie

Does this one really surprise you? On Angelina’s mother’s side, it’s believed she is connected to the first King of France, Phillip II, who ruled from 1180 to 1223.

Angelina Jolie

Elegant and regal in every red carpet appearance, Angelina Jolie’s royal connection is hardly a surprise.

It seems as if Jolie is related to French royalty through her mother, Marie Betrand, by her connection to the first King of France, Phillip II, who ruled from 1180 to 1223.

To sweeten the deal, Jolie and Queen Elizabeth II are 26th cousins.

Jake and Maggie Gyllenhaal

These ridiculously good-looking siblings through their father’s side are distant relatives of King Edward III and are also 19th cousins to the current queen of England, Elizabeth II.

Jake and Maggie Gyllenhaal

Hollywood’s favourite siblings may typically refrain from the spotlight, but their family history is certainly far from under-the-radar.

The siblings are distant relatives of King Edward III and are also 19th cousins to the late queen of England, Elizabeth II.

Brad Pitt

Brad and Angelina really were the King and Queen of Hollywood. Turns out Brad is connected to King Henry II through his mother.

Brad Pitt

Handsome, talented and royal? Pitt might be one of Hollywood’s leading men, but he’s also connected to King Henry II through his mother’s family tree. Which makes him the Queen’s 25th cousin, twice removed.

Brooke Shields

The original Queen of the bold brow is distant relative of France’s King Henry IV and is also connected to Catherine de Medici and Lucrezia Borgia, the daughter of Pope Alexander VI.

Brooke Shields

It looks as if Brooke Shields is next in line for America’s most-royal celebrity, after Hilary Duff. The original queen of the bold brow is distant relatives with France’s King Henry II, which makes her Queen Elizabeth’s 18th cousin, once removed.

Shields is also connected to Catherine de Medici and Lucrezia Borgia, the daughter of Pope Alexander VI.

Paris Hilton

Paris never ceases to amaze us. Your ’00s Queen happens to be the 20th cousin of Queen Elizabeth II through her dad Rick’s side of the family.

Paris Hilton

Paris Hilton never ceases to amaze us. The Simple Life star is not only the queen of the early ’00s but also happens to be the 20th cousin of Queen Elizabeth II through her dad, Rick Hilton’s side of the family.

Prince William and Prince Harry

As Prince William and Prince Harry are famous for their royal family, their lineage goes even further back than we thought. Prince Philip, their grandfather, is connected to Russian royalty through his paternal grandmother, Olga Constantinovna of Russia, the granddaughter of Nicholas I.

Which means that their grandfather is the great-great-grandson of Nicholas I, the Emporor of Russia from 1825 to 1855.

And as if it couldn’t get any better, Nicholas I was the son of Paul I, who was the son of Catherine the Great. Yes, the Catherine The Great that Elle Fanning plays in the eponymous series.

Tom Hanks

Hollywood royalty and actual royalty. Tom Hanks through his father’s side is a descendant of King John of England, who reigned from 1199 to 1216.

Tom Hanks

Hanks may be Hollywood’s most humble actor but he is also actual royalty. The Forrest Gump star, through his father’s side, is a descendant of King John of England, who reigned from 1199 to 1216. Which makes him 24th cousin to Queen Elizabeth.

Hugh Grant

This charming Brit happens to be a distant ancestor of Henry VII. We always knew there was something ~special~ about him.

Hugh Grant

British heartthrob, Hugh Grant, is not only ’90s rom-com royalty, but apparently he’s actual royalty too. As Queen Elizabeth’s ninth cousin, Grant happens to be a distant ancestor of Henry VII of England and King James IV of Scotland.

We always knew there was something ~special~ about him.

Johnny Depp

During an episode of Who Do You Think You Are Johnny discovered that he is a 20th cousin of Queen Elizabeth II.

Johnny Depp

An actor and musician, Depp looks to be adding ‘royal’ to his list of accomplishments. During an episode of Who Do You Think You Are, Depp discovered that he is a 20th cousin to Queen Elizabeth II, due to his lineage to Edward III.
